meanings.definition: A one-piece outer garment worn for protection and as a uniform, typically covering both the upper and lower body.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic wore coveralls to keep his clothes clean while working on the car.
meanings.sent2: My dad wears coveralls when he goes hunting in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut put on his coveralls before floating in space, looking like a colorful marshmallow.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity was his coveralls, protecting him from the harsh criticism of the world.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's bright red coveralls made him easily visible in the smoke-filled room.

meanings.definition: A protective outer garment worn over other clothing, typically made of heavy-duty fabric.
meanings.sent1: The workers put on coveralls before entering the hazardous area.
meanings.sent2: The beekeeper wore coveralls to shield himself from bee stings.
meanings.sent3: The chef wore coveralls to protect his clothes from getting splattered with sauce.
meanings.sent4: The knight's armor was like a set of coveralls, shielding him from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's white coveralls were stained with colorful chemicals after a day in the lab.
